summary:
Fiercely detail-oriented tailor with a comprehensive knowledge of garment development, construction and finishing and an exceptional ability to customize garments and personalize fit. 

Areas of expertise include pattern drafting, pattern manipulation and laying,  and garment construction. I also have several years' experience altering garments from all categories, which provides me with a vast understanding of construction and finishing techniques and the ability to reverse-engineer almost anything.  Additionally, I possess a working knowledge of technical drawing and specification presentation.

My exceptional eye for recognizing and correcting issues of fit and overall aesthetic impression contribute to my ability to translate aesthetic intent from specifications to finished product through all steps of garment development, finishing and delivery.

projects.title: Colourful full-figured vintage-inspired bridal set
projects.description:
Objective: Create a colourful yet traditional bridal look to please a non-traditional bride and her traditional family
Outcome: Two piece, fifties-inspired tea-length bridal set. Yellow, full-skirted cocktail reception dress with short-sleeved, tea-length lace jacket for a more traditional look during the ceremony. Also created custom birdcage veil and matching feathered hairpiece.

projects.title: Corsetry
projects.description: Custom designed, drafted and constructed Victorian-inspired corset to be worn as foundation garment in steampunk- themed wedding. This is a fully functional foundation garment, supported with spiral steel bones and a stainless steel front busk closure, durable enough for daily wear. The client, who is not a daily corset wearer, comfortably obtained a 15% waist reduction in this garment.

projects.title: Elegant Vegas chapel bridal gown
projects.description: Collaborated with the bride, combining elements from a number of sources to design, draft and construct a custom bridal gown for her intimate Vegas chapel wedding. She wanted something soft and feminine, yet not overly dramatic or formal.

projects.title: Semi-formal autumn wedding gown, cape and groom's accessories
projects.description: Collaborated on design from other inspiration photos with the bride to design, draft and construct this flowing semi-formal wedding gown and matching cape, as well as matching groom's vest, tie and pocket flare.

projects.title: Judas Heart
projects.description: For the summary project in Fanshawe's Fashion Design Diploma Program, each student is asked to create a line of clothing from proposed consumer base, through all steps of design and construction process. This includes mood, concept and line boards, fashion illustrations, technical specifications, costing sheets, pattern drafting, construction and runway presentation. These are the fashion photos and portions of the line book of Judas Heart

profile_positions.description: Learning the craft of shoemaking had always been on my bucket list. I applied at Jitterbug in the slow season for film work and was taken on full time to build shoes for theatre, circus and film. I had my hands on everything from aquatic circus shoes for La Reve in Vegas to Victorian button-up ankle boots for films still in production. While I'm no master yet, I've grasped the foundations and learned the basic machinery, adhesives, techniques and materials that go into a wide variety of footwear.
profile_positions.title: Apprentice Shoemaker

profile_positions.description: Working on a Guillermo del Toro film set in 1940's middle America that is still in production, with costumes designed by Luis Sequeira, I took patterns drafted by my supervising cutter, cut the textiles and findings for our stitcher, then switched gears to help build men's and women's costumes accurately to the era as needed. The production also outsourced some of our multiples to local small scale manufacturers, and it was my job to make the sample and assemble the pattern and tech pack to send. I really thrived on the variety this job provided as well as the collaborative aspect of liasing between designer/ cutter/ stitcher/ manufacturer/ buyers/ PAs.
profile_positions.title: Junior Cutter

profile_positions.description:
While on Star Trek, I moved from a stitching position to a cutting position within a few months. In this role, I interpreted design sketches, created patterns, cut costumes, followed tech pack instructions for materials and finishing and oversaw a 6 person team to create futuristic costumes for the most iconic sci-fi franchise in television history, designed by Gersha Philips, overseen by head cutter Tanya Batanau-Chuiko. 

This position was a real test of my time management skills, balancing pattern drafting, fittings, design meetings and managing my team of stitchers to make sure everything was up to standard, no pieces were missed and everything was ready on time, but ultimately I thrived in the role and my team and I worked flawlessly together.
profile_positions.title: Cutter (Star Trek Discovery season 3)

profile_positions.description: Worked as part of a 20 person team to create futuristic costumes for the most iconic sci-fi franchise in television history, designed by Gersha Philips and cut by Tanya Batanau-Chuiko. This position was incredibly demanding, including some 18 hour days and 14 day stretches to make sure everything was screen-ready but ultimately intensely rewarding as it showed me what I was capable of in the right environment.
profile_positions.title: Stitcher (Star Trek Discovery season 3)
